summary: HPV vaccines help prevent certain types of HPV infections, which can cause various cancers and genital warts. There are six types of HPV vaccines, offering protection against 2, 4, or 9 HPV types. These vaccines are very safe and effective, especially for girls aged 9-14. They can prevent many cancers, including cervical, anal, and vaginal cancers, and are recommended by the World Health Organization (WHO). The WHO suggests one or two doses for this age group and two doses for older women. Many countries have adopted HPV vaccination programs, aiming to protect a large portion of the population.
title: HPV vaccine
